intro: Petrophile vana, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rockheath, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in heathland and woodland habitats. It has narrow, linear leaves that help reduce water loss, adapting it to its arid or semi-arid environment. Petrophile vana is an important component of the local flora and is adapted to specific ecological conditions.
